Improve this resume bullet:
""I need an enclosure to be designed in CAD. The enclosure needs to be designed with DfA principles to facilitate quick and easy assembly. As part of the task a part connecting a string/cable and a stepper motor needs to be designed.The enclosure houses 1 sensor, 1 PCB and 1 Stepper motor, this means both a electronic system and a mechanical is part of the enclosure.A light indication is mounted on the PCB, and needs to be visible on the front of the enclosure - current plan is achieving this with a 0.75mm end glow fiber cable.The part connecting the string/cable (controlling the mechanical system) and the stepper motor needs to be 3D printable as well. All needed details will be shared privately due to patenting.3D files are available for all internal components.The enclosure needs to consist of 2 parts, and be 3D printable. The two parts needs to click together for fully encapsulated design, but still be able to separate for service/repair.A future task includes adapting the design to injection molding.Budget: $150Posted On: February 23, 2024 11:27 UTCCategory: CADSkills:3D Modeling, 3D Design, Mechanical Design, Autodesk Fusion 360, Product Design, Mechanical Engineering, CADSkills: 3D Modeling, 3D Design, Mechanical Design, Autodesk Fusion 360, Product Design, Mechanical Engineering, CADCountry: Denmark""

""Hi there!We need 2-3 experienced writers who are good at writing Shifter Paranormal Romance novels. Main trope can be rejected mates, fated mates.The following requirements are a must:1. Use English as your first language or bilingual. Better to be a native speaker. Have no problem writing in English.2. Know all kinds of werewolf novels well. Have experience in writing Shifter Paranormal Romance novels would be preferred. You should be able to write a book about the "rejected mates" trope.3. Have good writing skills.4. Creative thinking ability and good communicative skills. You need to keep in touch with us all the time before the book is made.5. Have enough free time to finish 60,000 words in a month. (Write 15k words per week)Communication is very important. While writing, you could send the chapters you write to me and my team and I will read them and give you some suggestions or ideas to make the story better. We'll make the book together!We are offering a long-term and stable job. If you're interested, please send your samples to me.Start the application to this job with the word "noodles", so I know you have read this posting through, and I will use that as a screening tactic.Looking forward to working with you!Budget: $1,800Posted On: February 23, 2024 11:25 UTCCategory: GhostwritingSkills:Ghostwriting, Creative Writing, Ebook, Romance, WritingSkills: Ghostwriting, Creative Writing, Ebook, Romance, WritingCountry: United States""

""Hey there,We're TestGorilla, a fast-growing HR tech startup that helps hiring teams make better hiring decisions faster and bias-free.Over the past year, we’ve experienced tremendous growth. More than 10,000 companies have replaced CVs with our assessments to screen candidates in an unbiased and data-driven way.As we scale our efforts in 2023 and beyond, we’re looking for an expert in Prompt Engineering for Marketing Content to collaborate with us in creating a test to evaluate candidates who apply to positions that need good knowledge of Prompt Engineering for Marketing Content skills.**What's in for you?**- Build your reputation: We share information about you with thousands of our customers, which is a good opportunity to showcase your skills and expertise in your field. (If you prefer not to have your name shown, we can do that, too).- Receive expert coaching: This will be a rewarding and collaborative process. We'll be providing guidance and feedback throughout the project at predetermined intervals. In the end, we will also conduct a technical review with a third-party expert.- Be rewarded for your work: After successful completion of the test, if you demonstrated an outstanding overall performance throughout the project, you will be eligible for a bonus of up to 40% of the original fixed project rate. This performance bonus amount will be based on the following aspects:- Adherence to the schedule- Constant and clear communication- Expertise in the topic- Overall quality of work**What is this job about?**The project consists of three main sections:1. Creating a test structure, where you determine the 3-4 main skill areas to test and break those down into 4-6 specific categories of skills to include in each.2. Writing 104 questions based on that test structure. For each question, you'll have to write a brief rationale for the correct answer.3. Working with a third-party expert to ensure all technical details are correct.The test aims to evaluate candidates with intermediate-level professional experience with Prompt Engineering, specifically in marketing content scenarios.The test will be made primarily of scenario-based questions in a multiple-choice format. These questions will be based on real-life scenarios. That means we're not looking for theoretical or standard textbook questions that only show how "familiar" someone is in theory but questions that can evaluate actual practice through solving problems.All questions submitted must be your own, original work. All material is checked for originality and copyright issues.You can see samples below from similar topics we have created (click on the "preview questions" button to see four preview questions per test):[REDACTED_URL] project usually takes around 6-8 weeks (though it's not a full-time project), and weekly deliverables are expected. The project can move faster than proposed if you have the time availability.**Whom are we looking for?**You should:- Be a deep subject-matter expert in Prompt Engineering for Marketing Content with extensive experience in the field and a proven track record of creating appropriate material.- Have strong English writing skills since this project involves much writing that must be clear and precise.Experience as an instructor/coach in this area is preferred but not required.**Interested?**Here at TestGorilla, we eat our own dog food. Improve this resume bullet:
""OverviewWe have a software tool that compares two text documents, referred to as the "left" document and the "right" document. These documents can be in PDF, DOC, or DOCX format. The tool lets users analyze differences and decide whether to accept or reject these changes. After reviewing, users can create a new DOCX file that includes the accepted edits and marks the undecided changes with special tags (like 'w:ins' for added text or 'w:del' for deleted text). This new document starts as a copy of the right document, but it will use text from the left document where changes were not accepted. Any changes not decided upon will appear as open edits in Microsoft Word.What We NeedWe want to make a new tool or script that can take a list of changes (in a file called changeList.json) from our comparison tool and apply those changes correctly in a new third DOCX document, based on what users have accepted or rejected. To keep things straightforward, we will only provide DOCX files for comparison.The changeList.json file records all differences spotted by our tool. Differences include:Match: Text is the same in both documents.Insert: New text appears in the second document.Delete: Text from the first document is missing in the second.Replace: Text from the first document is changed in the second.Here’s an example of what the change list might contain:["kind": "match","text": "Documento"// ... more info here,"kind": "replace","leftText": "S","rightText": "s","status": "pending"// ... more info here// ... more changes listed]Consider any change not marked with status as pendingWhen applying a 'replace' action in the DOCX, it should be formatted like this:[w:del] ... [w:t]S[/w:t] ... [/w:del][w:ins] ... [w:t]s[/w:t] ... [/w:ins]If a user rejects a change, the original text (leftText) takes the place of the changed text (rightText) in the new document. If a change involves deleting text, that text should go back where it was originally, with the same style and format.The ChallengeThe main difficulty lies in transferring these changes into the third document when they involve tables. It's especially hard with tables that have removed rows and columns, or when cells are joined together or there are tables within tables. We'll provide example documents that include these tricky situations to help you understand what needs to be done.There are no strict rules about which technologies you must use, but our system works on Linux containers and we use Python. Your new tool or script must work within this environment. It should be able to run on Linux containers and be callable from Python code.Posted On: February 16, 2024 20:45 UTCCategory: Back-End DevelopmentSkills:Back-End Development, Python Script, REST API, Document Formatting, Python, Document Analysis, Document Automation, Document Management System, APISkills: Back-End Development, Python Script, REST API, Document Formatting, Python, Document Analysis, Document Automation, Document Management System, APICountry: Brazil""
